sql.query:
SELECT families.*, guardians.*
FROM families
INNER JOIN guardians ON (guardians.family = families.id) LEFT JOIN addresses ON (addresses.id = families.address)
WHERE families.uuid = :P1 /* {{$_GET.familyuuid}} */

SELECT addresses.street1, addresses.street2, addresses.unit, addresses.suburb, addresses.postcode, addresses.state, countries.name AS country_name, states.name AS state_name, addresses.uuid
FROM addresses
LEFT JOIN countries ON (countries.id = addresses.country) INNER JOIN states ON (states.id = addresses.state)
WHERE addresses.family_uuid = :P1 /* {{$_GET.familyuuid}} */

SELECT addresses.street1, addresses.street2, addresses.unit, addresses.suburb, addresses.postcode, addresses.state, countries.name AS country_name, states.name AS state_name
FROM addresses
LEFT JOIN countries ON (countries.id = addresses.country) INNER JOIN states ON (states.id = addresses.state)
WHERE addresses.uuid = :P1 /* {{familyDetails.address}} */

SELECT
       f.id,
       f.primaryGuardian,
       g.id,
       g.uuid,
       g.firstName,
       g.lastName,
       g.relationship,
        (
            SELECT GROUP_CONCAT(CONCAT_WS(': ', cT.abbr, p.phone) SEPARATOR ',\n ') AS phoneNumbers
            FROM phoneNumbers p LEFT JOIN contactTypes cT on p.type = cT.id
            WHERE guardianId = g.id
        ) AS phoneNumbers,
        (
          SELECT e.address FROM emails e WHERE guardianId = g.id LIMIT 1
        ) as email,
        (
            SELECT GROUP_CONCAT(CONCAT_WS(': ', cT.abbr, e.address) SEPARATOR ',\n ') AS emails
            FROM emails e LEFT JOIN contactTypes cT on e.type = cT.id
            WHERE guardianId = g.id
            LIMIT 1
        ) AS emailAddresses,
       IF(g.id = f.primaryGuardian, 1, 0) AS is_pg
FROM
     families f
         LEFT JOIN guardians g on f.id = g.family
WHERE
    f.uuid = :P1
GROUP BY
        f.id,
        g.id,
        g.firstName,
        g.lastName
ORDER BY is_pg DESC;

SELECT address
FROM emails
WHERE guardian_uuid = :P1 /* {{uuid}} */

SELECT id, firstName, lastName, family, relationship
FROM guardians
WHERE family_uuid = :P1 /* {{$_GET.familyuuid}} */

SELECT fn.*, user_create.firstName AS created_by_first, user_create.lastName AS created_by_last, user_update.firstName AS updated_by_first, user_update.lastName AS updated_by_last
FROM family_notes AS fn
LEFT JOIN db_users AS user_create ON (user_create.uuid = fn.created_by) LEFT JOIN db_users AS user_update ON (user_update.uuid = fn.updated_by)
WHERE fn.family_uuid = :P1 /* {{$_GET.familyuuid}} */
ORDER BY fn.priority DESC

SELECT guardians.firstName, guardians.lastName, guardians.id, guardians.relationship, guardians.family, emails.address
FROM guardians
LEFT JOIN emails ON (emails.guardianId = guardians.id)
WHERE guardians.id = :P1 /* {{familyDetails.primaryGuardian}} */

SELECT
    s.id,
    s.id,
    s.firstname,
    s.lastname,
    s.dob,
    CONCAT_WS(' ',
        CONCAT(TIMESTAMPDIFF( YEAR, s.dob, now() ), 'y'),
        CONCAT(TIMESTAMPDIFF( MONTH, s.dob, now() ) % 12, 'm')) AS age,
    s.rollsheetcomments,
    s.rollsheetmedical,
    s.additionalmedical,
    s.family,
    s.gender,
    s.level
FROM students s
WHERE family = :P1

SELECT *
FROM student_notes
WHERE student_uuid = :P1 /* {{uuid}} */
ORDER BY priority DESC

select COUNT(*) AS note_count, priority,
        case
            when priority = 1 then 'Lowest'
            when priority = 2 then 'Low'
            when priority = 3 then 'Medium'
            when priority = 4 then 'High'
            when priority = 5 then 'Critical'
        end as priority_name
from student_notes join students s on s.uuid = student_notes.student_uuid
where s.uuid = :P1
group by priority
order by priority desc
